q_option: Rate of thermal generation of electron-hole pair
1.q_string: The number of minority carriers crossing the junction of a diode depends primarily on the :

The number of silicon atoms per \(\mathrm{m}^{3}\) is \(5 \times 10^{28}\). This is doped simultaneously with \(5 \times\) \(10^{22}\) atoms per \(\mathrm{m}^{3}\) of Arsenic and \(5 \times 10^{20}\) per \(\mathrm{m}^{3}\) atoms of Indium. Calculate the number of electrons and holes. Given that \(\mathrm{n}_{i}=1.5 \times 10^{16} \mathrm{~m}^{-3}\). Is the material \(\mathrm{n}\)-type or \(\mathrm{p}\)-type?

In the given circuit, the voltage across the voltage across the load is maintained at \(12 \mathrm{~V}\). The current in the zener diode varies from \(0\) to \(50 \mathrm{~mA}\). The maximum power dissipated of the diode is:

Find the amount of work done in rotating a dipole of dipole moment \(3 \times 10^{-3} {~cm}\) from its position of stable equilibrium to the position of unstable equilibrium, in a uniform electric field of intensity \(10^{4} {~NC}^{-1}\).

A copper sphere of mass \(2 \mathrm{~gm}\) contains nearly \(2 \times 10^{22}\) atoms. The charge on the nucleus of each atom is \(29 \mathrm{e}\). What fraction of the electrons must be removed from the sphere to give it a charge of \(+2 ~\mu C\) ?
The coulomb force between \(2\) alpha particles separated by \(3.2 \times 10^{-15} {~m}\) will be:
An arc lamp operates at \(80 \mathrm{~V, 10 \ A}\). Suggest a method to use it with a \(240 \mathrm{~V}\) d.c. source. The value of the electric component required for this purpose is:

The external diameter of a \(\mathrm{5~m}\) long hollow tube is \(10 \mathrm{~cm}\) and the thickness of its wall is \(5 \mathrm{~mm}\). If the specific resistance of copper be \(1.7 \times 10^{-5}\) ohm-metre, then determine its resistance.
A conductor of length \(3 \mathrm{~m}\) area of cross-section \(0.02 \mathrm{~mm}^2\) having a resistance of \(2~ \Omega\). Then, find the electrical conductivity of the material of a conductor.
Determine the wavelength of a radiation emitted when \(\mathrm{He}^+\) makes a transition from the state \(\mathrm{n=4}\) to the state \(\mathrm{n=3}\).
In the spectrum of hydrogen, what is the ratio of the longest wavelength in the Lyman series to the longest wavelength in the Balmer series?
An electron is moving in an orbit of a hydrogen atom at the \(\mathrm{4^{th}}\) energy level. Find the number of spectral lines for a transition from here to the ground state.

The graph below shows variation of stopping potential \(\mathrm{V}_{0}\) versus frequency of incident radiation \(\mathrm{v}\) for two photosensitive metals \(\mathrm{A}\) and \(\mathrm{B}\). Determine which of the two metals has higher threshold frequency?

The mean free path of electrons in a metal is \(4 \times 10^{-8} \mathrm{~m}\). Determine the electric field which can give on an average \(2 \mathrm{~eV}\) energy to an electron in the metal in unit of \(\mathrm{V m^{-1}}\).
A light of wavelength \(4000 \mathrm{\mathring{~A}}\) is incident on a metal plate whose function is \(2 \mathrm{~eV}\). Determine the maximum kinetic energy of emitted photoelectron.

A pair of adjacent coils has a mutual inductance of \(\mathrm{1.5~H}\). If the current in one coil changes from \(0\) to \(\mathrm{20 ~A}\) in \(\mathrm{0.5 ~s}\), what is the change in flux linkage with the other coil?
Current in a circuit falls from \(\mathrm{5.0 ~A}\) to \(\mathrm{0.0 ~A}\) in \(\mathrm{0.1 ~s}\). If an average emf of \(\mathrm{200 ~V}\) induced, calculate the self-inductance of the circuit.

Two solenoids \(\mathrm{S}_1\) and \(\mathrm{S}_2\) have equal lengths of \(2 \mathrm{~m}\) and the solenoid \(\mathrm{S}_1\) is placed co-axially inside the solenoid \(\mathrm{S}_2\). The number of turns per unit length of both the solenoids is \(100\). The radius of the solenoid \(\mathrm{S}_1\) and \(\mathrm{S}_2\) is \(7 \mathrm{~cm}\) and \(14 \mathrm{~cm}\) respectively, then find the mutual inductance.
The refractive index of diamond is \(2.47\) and that of window glass is \(1.51\). How much faster does light travel in window glass than in diamond?

The number of waves in a \(4 \mathrm{~cm}\) thick strip of glass is the same as in \(5 \mathrm{~cm}\) thick water layer, when the same monochromatic light travels in them. If the refractive index of water is \(\frac{4}{3}\), what will be that of glass?

A \(5 \mathrm{~cm}\) long needle is placed \(10 \mathrm{~cm}\) from a convex mirror of focal length \(40 \mathrm{~cm}\). What happens to the size of image when the needle is moved farther away from the mirror?

The current in the toroid of average radius \(\mathrm{r}\) and number of turns \(\mathrm{N}\) is \(\mathrm{I}\), then how the magnetic field intensity \(\mathrm{B}\) inside the toroid is related to the average radius?
The magnetic field \(\overrightarrow{dB}\) at a point \(\vec{r}\) distance away from a current element \(\overrightarrow{dl}\) carrying a current \(I\) is:

A circular coil \(\mathrm{A}\) of radius '\(\mathrm{a}\)' carries current '\(\mathrm{I}\)'. Another circular coil \(\mathrm{B}\) of radius '\(\mathrm{2 a}\)' also carries the same current of '\(\mathrm{I}\)'. The ratio of magnetic fields at the centers of the circular coils are:

The magnetic field in a plane electromagnetic wave is given by \(B_{y}=\left(2 \times 10^{-7}\right) \mathrm{T} \sin \left(0.5 \times 10^{3} x+1.5 \times 10^{11} t\right)\). This electromagnetic wave is:
Structure of solids is investigated by using _________.
The decreasing order of wavelength of infrared, microwave, ultraviolet and gamma rays is:
